revised_title: Temperature Dependence of Vibrational Relaxation in Polar and Non-Polar Gases
tldr: The authors conducted ultrasonic dispersion measurements on various gases to study the temperature dependence of vibrational relaxation times. They found that non-polar gases show a steady increase in energy transfer between translation and vibration with rising temperature, while polar gases behave differently, with some showing a rise in transition probability at lower temperatures due to the increasing predominance of oriented collisions.
